result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. George J Sleben Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George J Sleben Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Prosecution Agreement successfully completed.  Count 2 dismissed.

Defendant George J Sleben in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 2.  Court withheld adjudication.  Approved and entered into the Deferred Prosectution Agreement.  Ct. 1 dismissed but read in.  Ct. 3 dismissed.  Review scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 07:45 am.

Defendant George J Sleben in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant George J Sleben in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sarbacker requesting new dates, bond cont'd  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant George J Sleben in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sarbacker requesting new dates, bond cont'd  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Indigency hearing on August 7, 2014 at 3:30 pm.
Faxed copy of Public Defender Eligibility Evaluation form filed.

records.addlTxt: No contact with B.S. or her residence, or employment.  May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Standard felony conditions.

Defendant George J Sleben by video, in custody with attorney Randall M. Holtz.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $5000.00 signature bond.  No contact with B.S. or her residence, or employment.  May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
